title: Data Integration Manager Nordics
description:
**Abbott Diabetes Care Division**
 We are committed to assisting individuals with diabetes in managing their health by offering life-changing products that provide precise data to drive well-informed decisions. We are transforming the way people monitor their glucose levels with our innovative sensing technology.
   

  

**The opportunity**
 In the role of Data Integration Manager Nordics, you will be responsible for the day-to-day management, contracting, and successful implementations of Abbott Diabetes Care´s healthcare software integrations into Electronic Medical Records (EMR).
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Understand business needs from multiple stakeholders in terms of data integration, translate these needs into technical requirements that meet the capabilities of our interfaces.
* Manage key aspects of assigned projects over the project lifespan (initiation, planning, execution, controlling, and closure), ensuring successful customer acceptance and closure of each project.
* The data integration manager is not directly involved in the technical implementation of a software project, which is led by the R&D team.
* Travel to customer sites within Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland to conduct project kick-off, planning, technical requirement gathering, project closure meetings, post project support, as necessary.
* Closely work and partner with external customers, EMEA, Global Strategic Marketing, Global Business Development, and Global R&D on feasibility and technical implementation of data integration projects
* Provide management oversight for each project and communicate the project schedule to internal stakeholders and customer project teams. Track and report project milestones.
* Act as point of contact on EMR integration in the Nordics for internal stakeholders.
* Develop and provide strategic planning and commercial input to the development of the data integration solutions, understanding the key market drivers, priorities, and growth opportunities.
* Help to envision future digital health solutions needs among changing business processes and models.
* Maintain expert knowledge of cloud-based APIs, JSON and HL7 data formats, OAuth2.0 authentication format as well as any other healthcare and general IT security standards.
* The Data Integration Manager Nordics is responsible for negotiating & aligning technical & contractual requirements for data integration projects with customers in the Nordics (tender managers, KOLs, HCPs).
* Leading and owning the planning, scheduling, and coordinating the efforts of ADC´s data integration projects to meet customer requirements and timelines.This requires in depth knowledge of our digital health tool ecosystem and its technical interfaces paired with the local EMR market and requirements.


**Qualifications**
* Previous experience and track record in negotiating & aligning technical requirements for cloud-based data integration projects.
* Experience in data sharing and EMR integration of cloud-based health data e.g. via API using JSON and HL7 data formats as well as OAuth 2.0 authentication.
* At least 7 years of previous relevant experience, preferably within the medical device or pharmaceutical industry.
* Proficiency in one programming language and knowledge of databases.
* Proficiency in software development practices such as software project management, requirements management and change management.
* Experience in working in matrix organizations.
* Knowledge in Health Care or MedTech or Pharma, ideally the Diabetes sector
* Nice to have an experience in AI to help in advancing our digital health solution in leveraging the potentials of AI.
* Innovative thinking, analytical skills and ability to build trustworthy relationships with internal and external key stakeholders
* Excellent ability to communicate with all levels of the organization, tailoring communication and presentations to a diverse audience
* Capability to work under pressure in a dynamic environment to deliver on communicated timelines and objectives
* Must be fluent in written and spoken English and in one of the Nordics languages.
* Understanding of the adherence to internal security requirements and applicable Data Protection legislation
* Ability to travel up to 50% (mostly within Nordics. Approximatively once per quarter, travel to Germany Headquarter as well)


**What can we offer you?**
 Abbott provides a varying, challenging, and international position in a dynamic working environment. In our organization, you can count on excellent primary and secondary benefits, a positive working atmosphere, a personal growth plan, extensive training opportunities, and a good career perspective. We are in the business of advancement, both in health solutions and in the lives and careers of our employees. Our work across the world and in many areas of healthcare provides a rich environment for our employees to explore career paths, interests, and opportunities.
   

  

 Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that can help you build your future and live your best life. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.
   

  

 Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott, and Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.
   

  

**About Abbott**
 Abbott is a global healthcare leader, creating breakthrough science to improve people’s health. "We are constantly focused on the future, expecting advancements in medical science and technology."
   

  

 From removing the regular pain of finger pricks as people manage their diabetes to connecting patients to doctors with real-time information monitoring their hearts, from easing chronic pain and movement disorders to testing half the world’s blood donations to ensure a healthy supply, our purpose is to make the world a better place by bringing life-changing health technologies to the people who need them.
   

  

 That’s our commitment to helping you live your best life.

title: 1st Line Manager for the CI-Machine - Scania
description:
**Introduction**
***Are you a star in making your team love to go to work to solve more complex problems together? Then keep reading and apply!***
 We are building up a new functionality for Scania, that will be a game changer for our ability to develop new solutions. It is on high complexity level and therefore we have started to gather some of the large brains of Scania, combining that with people loving leaders and ambitious developers. The first steps we have taken prove we can deliver fantastic value for the company, and with the raised expectations we need level up with competence to reach even higher grounds!
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* You will be in an environment where we are going from start-up to just having released the first part of the product - a workplace environment that values creative problem solving, open communication and a flat hierarchy, also now when the processes for release, support etc are being formed
* You will get the chance to practise your leadership – both when it comes to build up your organisation but also practise the leadership needed in the different phases of the group dynamics
* You will be surrounded by high competent colleagues


**What is it that we do?**
 Scania is dedicated to reach the science based targets with a sustainable transportation solution. In the ever changing world – capabilities to give frequent iterations with fast feedback loops is the key for getting speed and flexibility in the development of new solutions. The CI-machine is the key enabler for this! Simplified you can say, that we work to make the world better!
   

  

 Today many companies implement Continuous Integration/ Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) for their software development. Some have also succeeded to implement it for both software and hardware for a specific product platform. Our task is to create an automated pipeline – integration as a service - so that a designer or can Build, Configure and Trigger relevant tests - for both software and hardware, for the complete Scania modular system.
   

  

 This we will be cutting edge!! And when we succeed we will be in a position that gives Scania and the other brands in our group a super chance to succeed in developing sustainable solutions with World class Speed and Flexibility!
   

  

**Who Are You**
 We believe you recognize yourself in the picture below, either since you have experience or the skills to handle the challenges:
   

  

 To be a servant leader who is motivating, involving and building great diverse and agile development teams comes natural for you.
   

  

 You strive for growing together with your teams and you believe in a modern organizational culture where you value people and their possibilities.
   

  

 Working strategic together with your colleagues in both IT and business, you inspire your team to execute in the right direction.
   

  

 To be successful in your role, you have the courage to test new ideas in short iterations. You continuously change based upon the outcome and you see creativity and enthusiasm as a great way of working.
   

  

 We believe you have the skills to assess competencies in software development (e.g. Java/Python development, AWS), Data Science/Machine Learning, IT architecture, project management, business requirements as the role will include recruiting in these areas. If you have experience in recruiting and team composition, this is an advantage.
   

  

**Me as your manager**
 I think the way to solve difficult tasks together goes hand in hand with having high openness and trust within the team. I believe we all are equal when it comes to having the need of feeling competent, loved and have the possibility to affect our work situation.
   

  

 In my leadership, I strive to create and live up to that work culture as we build up the individuals to a great team.
   

  

***Any questions, don’t hesitate to contact me, +46707750268 or***
***ikaros.dimitriou@scania.com***
 You can also talk to Samira Nikkar, 1st Line Manager in the CI-VCT, who is working with me as manager.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, agile and collaborative environment where your knowledge and skills are highly valued. You will be encouraged to take initiatives and dare to try new things as part of an agile and empowered development team.
   

  

 Scania’s culture is characterized by openness, diversity and respect for the individual. The people who work here are our most important asset, so we will invest in you to help you grow with us.
   

  

 As a Scania employee, you are offered several benefits in addition to personal and professional development opportunities. These benefits include mutual bonus, leasing car, occupational pension and flexible working hours.
   

  

**Application**
 Welcome with your application as soon as possible but at the latest 18th of August. Your application shall include your CV and copies of your degree diploma /certificates. Selections will start week 32.
   

  

 We will not handle any applications by email, only through the application system.
   

  

 Please notice that for this position, we might conduct a background check for the final candidate.
   

  

*Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2022, we delivered 80,238 trucks, 4,994 buses as well as 13,400 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 170 billion, of which 21 percent were services related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 57,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com*

title: IT-specialist inom IAM och webbproxys, Stockholm
description:
Placeringsort Flera orterDiarienummer FK 2024/014827
   

  

 Logga in och sök jobbet Öppnas i nytt fönster
   

  

*Varje år fattar Försäkringskassan 24 miljoner beslut som påverkar människors liv och hela samhället. Vi betalar ut cirka 250 miljarder kronor varje år. Det är allas skattepengar vi har hand om. Det är ett stort ansvar. Därför tänker vi nytt och använder den senaste tekniken för att förenkla och förbättra, utveckla och leverera it-tjänsterna för den svenska socialförsäkringen. Välkommen till en av Sveriges största it-avdelningar.*
 Vi är nu inne i ett expansivt skede med nya krav och behov gällande den interna och externa integrationen och söker en kvalificerad it-tekniker för att klara den dagliga produktionen, samt för att utveckla och tillföra nya teknologier för att möta Försäkringskassans framtida behov.
   

  

**IAM, skalskydd och webbproxys**
 I teamet ansvarar och leder ni utveckling samt förvaltning av produkter och tjänster gällande trafikstyrning, skalskydd, autentisering, auktorisering, signering och federering inom Försäkringskassan och samverkande myndigheter.
   

  

 Tjänsten innebär att du hanterar sekretessbelagda uppgifter vilket ställer höga krav på rätt hantering. Därför är det viktigt att du som ska arbeta hos oss har högt säkerhetsmedvetande.
   

  

 Det är ett jobb för dig som vill vara med och ta ansvar.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* har högskoleexamen eller erfarenheter och kvalifikationer som kan prövas likvärdiga
* har specialistkompetens och sakkunskap som it-tekniker
* behärskar svenska i tal och skrift och har goda kunskaper i engelska
* är ansvarsfull och drivande
* självständigt kan planera ditt och andras arbete
* är stabil och strukturerad, även under stark tidspress
* har en stark känsla för kvalitet och service samt tycker om att arbeta proaktivt med ständiga förbättringar
* har en god samarbetsförmåga.


 Det är meriterande om du kan och förstår
   

  

* Apache webbproxy och dess roll som säkerhetskomponent
* implementation och konfiguration av IAM-lösningar
* arbete med unixbaserade applikationer/tjänster
* certifikatshantering
* lastbalansering
* integrationer via SAML, OIDC eller liknande protokoll
* LDAP
* aktivitetsledning.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Övrigt
   

  

 En tjänst, tillsvidare, heltid, med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Provanställning kan bli aktuellt. I enlighet med Försäkringskassans riktlinje för säkerhet genomförs bakgrundskontroller i denna rekrytering. För den här tjänsten krävs svenskt medborgarskap. I den här rekryteringen kan arbetspsykologiska test användas som en del i urvalsarbetet. Placeringsorter: Sverige, ort enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om Försäkringskassans it-avdelning? Besök Jobba med it på Försäkringskassan
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om Försäkringskassan som arbetsgivare? Besök Jobba på Försäkringskassan
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Chef: Per-Erik Näsholm, tel 070-201 55 33 (för frågor om tjänsten). HR-specialist: Mats Törngren, tel 010 113 44 13 (för frågor om rekryteringsprocessen). Fackliga representanter är för ST: Marie Nordenfjäll, Saco-S: Ann Wiström och Seko f.seko@forsakringskassan.se. Dessa nås via vår växel 08-786 90 00.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 2024-08-31. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande under annonseringstiden. Ladda gärna upp dina examensbevis, betyg och intyg i samband med din ansökan. I den här rekryteringen tar vi inte emot personligt brev. Du kommer i stället att få möjlighet att besvara urvalsfrågor
 **.** 
 Dina svar blir en viktig del i vårt urvalsarbete.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontaktar du den HR-specialist som finns namngiven i annonsen så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan.
   

  

 Försäkringskassan arbetar aktivt för att vara en myndighet fri från diskriminering.

title: Procurement Solutions Architect
description:
*From ideas to reality. Decode the future.*
 At Electrolux, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home.
   

  

**All About The Role**
 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Solutions Architect to oversee and enhance our Procurement solutions landscape. The role demands a proactive approach in identifying technological opportunities for improvement, reducing complexity, and driving cost efficiencies across the procurement function.
   

  

 As Solutions Architect you will be responsible for the IT architecture and design principles that shall apply to the IT solutions within the Procurement organization. You are expected to drive standardization, design, implement and manage technology solutions, ensuring scalability and alignment with our business objectives and IT standards, in relation to the Procurement IT landscape.
   

  

 Success in the position requires developing a close working relationship with key stakeholders in Procurement, Product Sourcing, and wider IT organization. Establishing and maintaining relationships with external IT partners/suppliers is another key success factor.
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

* Solution Ownership: Maintain a comprehensive overview of the current procurement solutions landscape, evaluating and managing the lifecycle of existing systems.
* Technology Solutioning: Proactively identify and design appropriate IT solutions for new business requirements, areas for improvement, and the replacement of outdated legacy systems.
* Solution Design and Documentation: Translate business user stories into detailed IT solutions, ensuring all designs meet the specified requirements and are well-documented.
* Compliance and Standards: Ensure all IT solutions adhere to Electrolux's IT standards and best practices, including security protocols.
* Functional Specifications: Develop clear and concise functional specifications for software developers to ensure accurate implementation of the required features.
* Infrastructure Implementation: Oversee and secure the implementation of necessary infrastructure to support new and existing applications.
* Solution Implementation Management: Manage the end-to-end process of solution implementation, focusing on technical aspects and excluding people change management.
* Level 3 Support: Provide expert-level support for advanced functionalities, addressing complex issues that surpass standard support levels.
* Configuration Management Database (CMDB): Ensure all relevant data related to the procurement solutions is accurately maintained and regularly updated in the CMDB.
* Operational Efficiency: Drive initiatives aimed at reducing the complexity of the solutions landscape and associated operational costs.
* Strategy: Support the development of IT roadmaps for the portfolio of applications in alignment with other related IT roadmaps (e.g. IT infrastructure) within the business area and at group level.


 Who you are
   

  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Systems Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience (minimum 5 years) as a Solutions Architect, with a focus on procurement or similar enterprise systems.
* Strong understanding of IT infrastructure, software development life cycle (SDLC), and current industry trends.
* Expertise in designing and implementing complex IT solutions.
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills, capable of working in a cross-functional environment and influencing business and technical leaders.
* Experience with compliance standards and IT governance.
* Familiarity with Configuration Management tools and processes.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously with a keen attention to detail.
* Previous exposure to Agile and DevOps environments.
* Fluency in English.


 Where you'll be
   

  

 This is a full-time position, based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm / Stadshagen (Sweden).
   

  

 At our Global Headquarters we are 60+ nationalities under the same roof, and we enjoy the look and feel of the office!
   

  

 Benefits highlights
   

  

* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family friendly benefits
* Insurance policy plan
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path


**As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.**

 Tjänsten innebär att du hanterar sekretessbelagda uppgifter vilket ställer höga krav på rätt hantering. Därför är det viktigt att du som ska arbeta hos oss har högt säkerhetsmedvetande.
   

  

 Det är ett jobb för dig som vill vara med och ta ansvar.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* har högskoleexamen eller erfarenheter och kvalifikationer som kan prövas likvärdiga
* har specialistkompetens och sakkunskap som it-tekniker
* behärskar svenska i tal och skrift och har goda kunskaper i engelska
* är ansvarsfull och drivande
* självständigt kan planera ditt och andras arbete
* är stabil och strukturerad, även under stark tidspress
* har en stark känsla för kvalitet och service samt tycker om att arbeta proaktivt med ständiga förbättringar
* har en god samarbetsförmåga.


 Det är meriterande om du kan och förstår
   

  

* Apache webbproxy och dess roll som säkerhetskomponent
* implementation och konfiguration av IAM-lösningar
* arbete med unixbaserade applikationer/tjänster
* certifikatshantering
* lastbalansering
* integrationer via SAML, OIDC eller liknande protokoll
* LDAP
* aktivitetsledning.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Övrigt
   

  

 En tjänst, tillsvidare, heltid, med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Provanställning kan bli aktuellt. I enlighet med Försäkringskassans riktlinje för säkerhet genomförs bakgrundskontroller i denna rekrytering. För den här tjänsten krävs svenskt medborgarskap. I den här rekryteringen kan arbetspsykologiska test användas som en del i urvalsarbetet. Placeringsorter: Sverige, ort enligt överenskommelse.

title: Säkerhetsskyddshandläggare till Sweco!
description:
Har du en bakgrund inom säkerhetskydd och vill ha ett jobb som gör skillnad? Till Sweco som är en helhetsleverantör av tjänster inom säkerhet och skydd, söker vi nu en Säkerhetskyddshandläggare! Läs mer om tjänsten här och skicka in en ansökan redan idag.
 



  

**Företag :**
 SWECO Sverige AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 HR/kontor/administration
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 För Swecos räkning söker vi nu en säkerhetsskyddshandläggare med betoning på säkerhetsprövningar med placering vid deras huvudkontor på Kungsholmen i Stockholm. Avdelningen består av en säkerhetsskyddschef tillika säkerhetschef, en biträdande säkerhetsskyddschef samt två säkerhetsskyddshandläggare.
 


  


 Som säkerhetsskyddshandläggare hos Sweco kommer du få stora möjligheter att utvecklas både personlighets- intresse- och erfarenhetsmässigt, i ett bolag som ständigt utvecklas. Här får du möjlighet att vara en del av företagets arbete med att bistå Swecos kunder i att skydda viktiga funktioner i samhället. Hos Sweco blir du del av ett starkt team som kompletterar och ställer upp för varandra i verksamheten.
 


  


 Tjänsten är ett bemanningsuppdrag via Academic Work som förväntas pågå långsiktigt förutsatt att samarbetet fungerar bra.
   




**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Genomföra och följa upp säkerhetsprövningar
  
* Genomföra personutredningar vid särskilda händelser
  
* Administration i form av säkerhetsskyddsavtal, bakgrundskontroller, ansökan om registerkontroller, utbildningar m.m.
  
* Utveckla, driva och säkerhetställa att säkerhetsskyddet i Sweco efterlevs
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en avslutad universitetsutbildning inom säkerhet, beteendevetenskap, IT eller liknande
  
* Har intresse för system, IT och säkerhet
  
* Har lätt för att sätta dig in i nya system och arbetssätt
  
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska då bägge språken används i det dagliga arbetet
  
* Har erfarenhet av arbete inom säkerhetsskydd
  
* Har säkerhetsbakgrund av något slag exempelvis informationssäkerhet, personalsäkerhet eller om du studerat på eftergymnasial nivå inom ämnet
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Ansvarstagande
  
* Stabil
  
* Ordningsam
  
* Intellektuellt nyfiken
  


  


 I den här processen kommer dina personliga egenskaper vara avgörande. För att lyckas i tjänsten är bör du vara driven, trygg, pålitlig och ha hög integritet. Vidare är du noggrann, kvalitetsmedveten och har en välutvecklad analytisk förmåga. Du behöver även ha en god kommunikativ- och pedagogisk förmåga, vilket gör att du skapar förtroende och förståelse till våra medarbetare. För dig är det viktigt att driva uppgifter framåt och i mål.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
 


  


 Går du vidare i processen kommer bakgrundskontroller genomföras som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Alina Finnberg eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stn01@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105313

title: Engineering Manager - Design System
description:
Our vision is to transform presentations, meetings and lectures by turning passive audiences into engaged contributors. We make this possible through our interactive presentation platform where the traditional presentation monologue becomes an inclusive dialogue. We believe in the power of together and that the most successful leaders listen to be heard.
   

  

 With Mentimeter, users become the best presenter they can be. Meetings become more productive, participants learn more and have fun whilst doing it.
   

  

 We have more than 300 million users and customers worldwide, on our way of making the world a better place, one presentation at a time.
   

  

**!! During the summer vacation period we will continue to review applications however, Interviews will re-commence in August !!**
 To succeed in our mission to create a world-class product experience, we have a Design system team that builds the foundation for the Mentimeter product, fueled by our desire to challenge tomorrow’s presentation and meeting experiences. This role will be based in our Stockholm office.
   

  

**The role**
 As an
 **Engineering Manager** 
 for our design system team, you will be responsible for people, delivery, strategy and for ensuring a team and its stakeholders can depend on high-quality technical work.
   

  

 In this role you will ensure the team delivers exceptional results, promoting empowerment and sustainable practices. You'll be pivotal in guiding sound decision-making and fostering a productive environment.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Be the line manager of engineers in the team, oversee their well-being and professional development, and actively coach and inspire them to reach their full potential.
* Be a strong voice for tech in the team and advocate for good practices aligned with our tech strategy.
* Foster great collaboration and psychological safety in the team through leading, planning and facilitating agile team rituals like planning, refinement, retros and offsites.
* Engage in strategic decision-making, collaborating across departments and teams to amplify the impact of the design system.
* Manage and communicate complex roll-outs of changes across all parts of the Mentimeter product that impact multiple teams, in a way where they feel included and heard.


 You will be part of the Design Foundation Area where the design system team resides. As of 2023, we have 4 areas within the Product department; Core, Commercial, Design Foundation and Tech Foundation.
   

  

**Skills And Requirements**
 As you will be managing software engineers you must have hands-on experience in front-end development that allows you to comfortably facilitate architectural discussions and sound technical decisions. Experience working in a design system context is highly desirable.
   

  

 You are accountable for delivery in the team and to efficiently do that we expect you to have a mindset of constantly pushing boundaries, both engineering and process wise. You also have experience of guiding teams through planning and delivery of modern features.
   

  

 Since design system work often involves roll-outs across multiple teams and applications, skills in communication and stakeholder management is an important part of the job in order to break down and deliver complex projects.
   

  

 Mentimeter is a fast-moving product-led growth company. Therefore you must desire to work in a fast-paced environment where change is the only constant. A good delivery mindset and experience with agile frameworks will help you a lot in this role.
   

  

****So, who are you?****
* 3+ years of experience as a team lead or managing engineers in leading and managing engineers in a cross-functional agile team
* Several years of technical experience, working as a front-end engineer or in a similar role.. If you have a passion for design systems and experience leading and/or working in a design system team that is a huge plus.
* Strong communication, storytelling, and facilitation skills, fostering unity and inspiring teams.
* Eagerness to contribute to a fast-growing organization and adapt to changing ways of working.


**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Once a year we also relocate to exciting places all over the world like Merida & Buenos Aires for our Toronto colleagues, cities in Europe (for our Stockholm colleagues), and cities in APAC (for our Sydney colleagues), paid for by us of course. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page .
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Managing Director, Trilogy (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 The professional services industry is undergoing a rapid transformation, driven by the need for increased efficiency and innovation. Despite the proliferation of AI tools, many organizations still grapple with manual workflows, slow customer feedback loops, and the challenge of building a distinct market presence. Data shows that companies implementing AI-driven productivity improvements can see up to a 40% increase in efficiency, yet only a small fraction have successfully integrated these advancements into their operations.
   

  

 At Trilogy, we are reimagining the role of AI in professional services by focusing on generative AI to streamline processes and enhance customer engagement. This approach not only drives significant productivity gains but also ensures our solutions are at the forefront of technological innovation. Our commitment to leveraging the latest advancements in AI sets us apart and creates a dynamic, impactful work environment.
   

  

 This role is not your typical CEO track focused on developing pie-in-the-sky strategies or schmoozing investors. Instead, you will spearhead AI-driven productivity improvements, interact directly with customers to gather and implement feedback, and work towards automating an entire organization. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on using cutting-edge technology to drive business impact and excels in a fast-paced, customer-centric environment.
   

  

 As part of our team, you will have the unique opportunity to drive productivity and customer engagement across over 100 software products, all while bypassing the usual internal logistics of a traditional CEO role. If you are passionate about AI, eager to make a significant impact, and excited about building your brand, we encourage you to apply and join us on this transformative journey.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Implementing AI-driven Productivity Improvements: Utilizing generative AI tools to streamline and automate various workflows across the organization.
* Customer Engagement and Feedback: Interacting with customers to gather insights and feedback, and using this information to enhance product offerings.
* Develop a Personal Monopoly: Publishing podcast episodes and blog posts and building a social media following to evangelize your portfolio's AI-driven products.


**Managing Director Key Responsibilities**
* Transform a large professional services organization through the innovative use of generative AI


**Basic Requirements**
* At least 8 years of work experience in a professional services organization
* Experience using generative AI tools to achieve quantifiable productivity improvements
* Currently based in North America, South America, or Europe


**About Trilogy**
 Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

title: Senior Business Developer - Solar Parks
description:
The Utility team at Svea Solar is responsible for large PV projects. We are currently a market leader in Sweden and on a strong growth path across Europe. For instance, we've built a solar park in Fjällskär (20.7 MW), making it Sweden’s biggest park. Now we are looking for our next Senior Business Developer to help scale our business even further!
   

  

**The role**
 As a Senior Business Developer, you'll be responsible for driving the largest revenue projects within Svea Solar, which significantly impacts the company's overall growth targets. The Utility team currently has a strong market share of +60 % which creates a strong platform to grow in this role.
   

  

 The market and our business model are in a sustainable hypergrowth stage. By joining now, you can shape the way solar will be developed, built, sold & bought in Sweden for years to come. More specifically, the role entails but is not limited to:
   

  

* Establishing and managing contacts with potential customers, such as developers, industries and land & property owners, who want to build a solar park.
* While acting as the first point of contact for the customer, work closely with the EPC (Engineering, Procurement & Construction) team as well as suppliers and partners to craft the optimal solution for each project.
* Building strong relationships with key stakeholders and continuously maturing and prioritising your pipeline.
* Responsibility from the first point of contact with a new customer all the way to finalised and signed agreement, after which it is handed over to the operations team.


 The team is consisting of five people right now, but our aim is to grow the team to seven during this year. If you want to hear more about the team, click on the link to read an interview with Magnus Bergqvist, Head of Utility Sales & Procurement.
   

  

**Are we a match?**
 We envision that you deliver at your best in an entrepreneurial environment with an actionable decision-making process. We are a great match if you enjoy the opportunity to influence and shape the direction of your work to a large extent, driven by mutual trust and ownership together with like-minded colleagues. You flourish in an environment where you can combine your technical skills and commercial drive in everything from initial technical layouts to extensive and complex tender negotiations.
   

  

 If you have a genuine interest in renewable energy, you will prosper at Svea Solar. If you also have experience with the technology behind solar energy, it is a strong merit but not a necessity. ☀️ In order to succeed and further develop, we believe that a great match has:
   

  

* Around 5-10 years of previous experience and proven track record from sales or business development in large-scale utility, industrial-scale projects or similar technical environments.
* Experience and confidence in driving and negotiate close to three-digit million SEK project deals.
* University education within engineering
* Fluency in English.
* Curiosity and willingness to continuously learn and grow together with us and the industry.


**Diversity & Inclusion**
 Svea Solar believes that a diverse workplace leads to the creativity that’s necessary for the industry to keep on growing in a sustainable & innovative way. We welcome new co-workers from different backgrounds and experiences to represent the diversity of our community and customers.
   

  

**Background check**
 We conduct background checks via Verifiera on all final candidates to ensure that all the candidates being considered for employment has a background that is compatible with Svea Solar’s core values.
   

  

 Read more about Svea Solar: https://sveasolar.com

title: Manager Business Solutions – Finance, NCC Business Services
description:
*Vill du spela en nyckelroll i NCC:s förändringsresa samt utveckla och leda delar av ett Business Service i toppklass? Drivs du av processutveckling och automation samt att motivera och leda i förändring?*
*Vi söker nu dig som är en driven förändringsledare, god kommunikatör med sinne för siffror och system. Låter det lockande, då kan tjänsten som Manager Business Solutions på NCC vara rätt för dig!*
**Tjänsten som Manager Business Solutions**
 I rollen som Manager Business Solutions har du det övergripande ansvaret för processutveckling och systemstöd inom NCC:s Business Services (NBS). NBS uppdrag är att tillhandahålla och utveckla skalbara ekonomitjänster på ett kostnadseffektivt, kvalitativt och transparent sätt. Målet är att ha gemensamma processer och system med en hög grad av automation. Funktionen levererar ekonomitjänster till NCC koncernen i Sverige, Norge, Danmark samt Finland och består av ca 110 medarbetare.
   

  

 NCC står nu inför en större förändringsresa med flera systembyten samt övergång till ny ekonomimodell vilket innebär stora förändringar för både verksamheten och stödfunktionerna. Systembytet kommer medföra nya arbetssätt och processer. I rollen som Manager Business Solutions kommer du och ditt team vara med och forma arbetssätt för Business Solutions, klargöra gränssnitt och roller mellan Finance och IT samt vara drivande i att säkerställa harmoniserade processer med hög kvalitet inom Finance med hjälp av ett effektivt IT/systemstöd.
   

  

 Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete inom NBS, IT och övriga affärsstödsenheter. Du har personalansvar för ca 8 medarbetare inom Business Solutions, rapporterar till Head of NBS och ingår i ledningsgruppen för NBS och relevanta forum. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med placering på NCCs huvudkontor i Solna.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Ansvarsområden Innefattar**
* Leda och utveckla funktionen Business Solutions inom NBS
* Ansvara för och säkerställa efterlevnad av Process Governance Framework inom NBS
* Ansvara för applikationsstöd för samtliga Finance system i samarbete med IT
* Säkerställa efterlevnad av gemensamma processer och intern kontroll
* Driva den strategiska utvecklingsagendan för NBS och leda prioriterade projekt
* Stakeholder Management – stärka och utveckla relationer med nyckelintressenter
* Omvärldsbevaka system- och automationslösningar som kan vara till nytta för NCC inom Finance området.
* Ansvara för budget och uppföljning


**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som har en akademisk utbildning inom ekonomi/redovisning alternativt inom IT/datavetenskap eller motsvarande utbildning
 *.* 
 Du har minst 3–5 års erfarenhet av ledarskap i förändring samt har erfarenhet av projektledning och processutveckling. Din systemkompetens är god och du har tidigare kunskap från förvaltningsmodeller inom IT och är van med nära samarbete med IT. Vidare har du en övergripande förståelse för ekonomiprocesserna såväl som affärsförståelse. Erfarenhet från Shared Service konceptet och en stor nordisk organisation är meriterande. Du uttrycker dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Vi söker en engagerad och driven ledare som har en stark kommunikationsförmåga som brinner för att arbeta med människor, processer och teknik. Du drivs av att arbeta med förbättringar och utveckling samt har ett stort intresse av att samarbeta med verksamheten för att uppnå gemensamma resultat. Du är modig, uppmärksam och har förmågan att inspirera och engagera dina medarbetare under ett långsiktigt förändringsarbete.
   

  

**NCC erbjuder**
 Vi på NCC vill vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare med medarbetare som trivs, utvecklas och mår bra. Därför erbjuder vi dig som arbetar hos oss ett stort utbud av personalförmåner. NCC har kollektivavtal för alla medarbetare. Det ger en bra grundtrygghet och ett tydligt regelverk så att du vet vad som gäller för din anställning. Vi erbjuder också försäkringar, arbetstidsförkortning, friskvårdsbidrag samt andra erbjudanden och rabatter.
   

  

**Kontakt och ansökan**
 I den här processen samarbetar NCC med Sharenode och vid eventuella frågor är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Sara Kölborg på mail sara.kolborg@sharenode.se.
   

  

 Då urvalsprocessen sker löpande är du varmt välkommen med din ansökan så snart som möjligt via den här länken: https://sharenode.recman.no/job.php?job\_id=387070 .
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Bygg med oss och få branschens bästa kollegor**
 På NCC drivs vi av att fortsätta utvecklas, oavsett om det handlar om våra byggprojekt eller vår personliga kompetens. Varje dag driver vi branschens mest spännande och komplexa byggprojekt framåt i ett nära samarbete mellan våra medarbetare, samarbetsparters och kunder. Hos oss är du en betydelsefull medarbetare som bidrar till de landmärken som definierar våra städer och samhällen. Här tar våra medarbetare en aktiv roll i en företagskultur grundad på stabila värderingar och beteenden för en trygg och säker arbetsplats. Vår samlade kompetens och varierande bakgrund gör skillnad.
   

  

**NCC - ett av de ledande byggföretagen i Norden**

title: Senior Data Scientist I Candy Crush Soda
description:
**Craft:**
 Data, Analytics & Strategy
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We are looking for a Data scientist who will contribute to the discovery and experimentation cycles by understanding, modelling, predicting and segmenting the behavior of our players. The goal is to drive product innovation and enhance our product's competitive edge in the market by learning how to better engage and retain our players. At Candy Crush Soda, you will collaborate closely with game designers, developers, product analysts, and operators, and forge a strategic partnership with product managers.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

 Data analysis and opportunity discovery
   

  

* Lead problem discovery alongside the product manager, conducting exploratory analysis to uncover player problems and needs that are in line with the opportunities being explored by the product team.
* Model desired player behaviour, with focus on segmentation of users.
* Conduct thorough data analysis using statistical methods to identify trends, patterns, and insights related to product performance and user behaviour.
* Identify gaps and opportunities within the product and subsequently propose data-informed product changes or enhancements.
* Develop new analyses, experiments and data-driven tools to harness business opportunities and share them with King’s data science community.


 Experimentation
   

  

* Work closely with game designers and the product team to scope and design tests, translating business needs to technical and AB test requirements (including correct implementation and event tracking).
* Design, implement, and analyse A/B tests to evaluate the impact of changes to the product, features, or user experience, making recommendations based on test outcomes.
* Monitor the performance of experiments and provide insights to optimise product features.


 Documentation and knowledge sharing
   

  

* Communicate findings and recommendations clearly to stakeholders across Soda.
* Document analytical processes, findings, and recommendations, ensuring knowledge is shared and accessible within the team and Soda.
* Champion data literacy within the cross-functional game team.


 Desired requirements
   

  

* Hands-on experience with data science in a product context.
* Demonstrable ability to extract, manipulate, and interpret large datasets, identifying trends, and making data-driven recommendations. This includes understanding key performance indicators (KPIs) relevant to product success.
* Experience working with data using SQL and creating sophisticated queries.
* Practical experience with an analytical programming language such as R or Python for data manipulation.
* Strong understanding of statistical techniques such as hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and Bayesian data analysis.
* Adept in visualisation tools with experience in information visualisation and presentation.
* Ability to clearly articulate insights and recommendations to stakeholders, including those without a technical background. This includes excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.


 Bonus skills
   

  

* Previous game industry experience
* Previous experience working with Looker
* Experience in behavioural psychology/economics/game theory and experimental design
* Advanced machine learning
* Knowledge of user research and design thinking principles
* Experience with roadmap planning, understanding how data analysis informs the prioritisation of new features or enhancements to existing ones


**About King**
 At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Senior Director of Product Management, 2 Hour Learning (Remote) - $200,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, 2 Hour Learning. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Drive the AI-powered learning revolution at 2 Hour Learning - where student success hinges on your ability to engage, empathize, and innovate.
   

  

 At 2 Hour Learning, we're on a mission to flip the script on traditional education. Our academic ecosystem, powered by cutting-edge AI and learning science, is already enabling students to shatter learning goals in a fraction of the time. But we're just getting started.
   

  

 You'll be the catalyst that takes our AI-driven products to new heights of engagement and efficacy. This role is for educational visionaries ready to roll up their sleeves and get into the trenches with students and staff. You'll engage with users constantly, gathering raw insights to inform each product iteration. No hiding behind focus groups or third-party reports - you'll build trust and rapport directly with the students whose lives your products will transform.
   

  

 But gathering intel is just the start. You'll feed those insights into a non-stop cycle of AI-powered innovation. From generating new features with ChatGPT to automating marketing tasks to maintaining a comprehensive knowledge base, you'll wield AI as your copilot to bring products to life at light speed.
   

  

 You'll also flex your leadership chops, guiding outsourced dev teams to execute on your vision and quality standards. It's full ownership, full accountability, and full potential to make a seismic impact on education. If you're ready to shape the future of learning, one user insight and AI breakthrough at a time, this is the place for you.
   

  

 For more information on 2 Hour Learning, visit our website [https://2hourlearning.com/] and the Future of Education Instagram page [https://www.instagram.com/futureof\_education/]. To see a school built around 2 Hour Learning, check out Alpha [https://alpha.school/].
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Engaging directly with students and staff to gather raw feedback and transform it into actionable product enhancements
* Harnessing generative AI tools to rapidly ideate, prototype, and market new product concepts
* Taking full ownership of the product lifecycle from ideation through launch and iteration, with a relentless focus on student success
* Collaborating with outsourced dev teams to execute on product roadmap and maintain sky-high quality standards
* Immersing yourself in learning science and emerging AI tech to fuel a constant cycle of product innovation


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Treating product management as a purely theoretical exercise - you'll be in constant contact with actual students and users
* Waiting for lengthy research cycles to guide product decisions - you'll gather insights directly and leverage AI to move fast
* Passing the buck on product quality or timeline - you'll have full ownership and accountability for outcomes
* Resting on your laurels or settling for incremental improvements - the mandate is to push boundaries and aim for 10x gains


**Senior Director Of Product Management Key Responsibilities**
 Deliver AI-powered educational products and experiences that demonstrably drive unprecedented student engagement, efficacy, and delight.
   

  

**Basic Requirements**
* At least 5 years of product management experience
* Proficiency in leveraging AI tools for key product management tasks, including content creation, user interface optimization, and workflow automation
* Proven ability to gather detailed user feedback through interviews and other methods, analyze data to identify trends and pain points, and translate insights into actionable product improvements
* Demonstrated success managing development teams, ensuring their work aligns with product vision and meets rigorous quality standards
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a track record of using data to drive product decisions and measurably enhance user satisfaction
* Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to provide precise, actionable feedback to cross-functional teams and maintain regular, consistent communication with all stakeholders


**About 2 Hour Learning**
 2hr Learning is powered by AI technology that enables schools to provide personalized, mastery learning to students, enabling them to learn faster than standard school, thereby freeing up the rest of the school day to pursue their passions and interests.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.

title: Enterprise Account Executive, Growth
description:
The worldwide data management software market is massive (According to IDC, the worldwide database software market, which it refers to as the database management systems software market, was forecasted to be approximately $82 billion in 2023 growing to approximately $137 billion in 2027. This represents a 14% compound annual growth rate). At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a hardworking, driven individual with superb energy, passion and initiative for new business acquisition. The Account Executive role focuses exclusively on formulating and executing a sales strategy within an assigned territory, resulting in revenue growth and new customer acquisition.
   

  

 We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Stockholm for our hybrid working model.
   

  

**About The Sales Culture**
 MongoDB is always developing and innovating — not only in our technology, but also in our sales go-to-market strategy. Our sales leadership is committed to building the best salesforce in technology. This means, inspiring and enabling success for everyone on the team. We not only equip you to be successful and close deals, but we want your feedback and input on how we can continue to “Think Big and Go Far.” As a crucial part of the Sales team at MongoDB, you will have access to a lucrative market and learn how to sell from some of the most successful sales leaders in the software industry.
   

  

 What you will be doing
   

  

* Proactively, identify, qualify and close a sales pipeline (100% net new logos)
* Strategically prospect into CTOs, Engineering/IT Leaders, & technical end users
* Build strong and effective relationships, resulting in growth opportunities
* Partner with our Solution Architects and work closely with the Professional Services team to achieve customer satisfaction
* Work closely with the enterprise ecosystem partner sales and channel partner to maximise deal sizes
* Participate in our sales enablement trainings, including our comprehensive Sales Bootcamp, sophisticated sales training, and leadership and development programs


 What you will bring to the table
   

  

* 2+ years field experience of quota-carrying experience in a fast-paced and competitive market with a focus on strategically growing accounts
* Demonstrated ability to open new accounts and run a complex sales process
* A proven track record of overachievement and hitting sales targets
* Ability to articulate the business value of complex enterprise technology
* Skilled in building business champions
* Driven and competitive. Possess a strong desire to be successful
* Fluent in English


 Things we love
   

  

* Passionate about growing your career in the largest market in software (database)
* Previous Sales Methodology training (e.g. MEDDIC, SPIN, Challenger Sales)
* Familiarity with databases, develops and open source technology a plus


 Why join now
   

  

* MongoDB invests 8x the industry average in development of each of our new hires & continuous career development
* Accelerators up to 30%
* Best in breed Sales trainings in MEDDIC and Command of the Message, including our comprehensive Sales Bootcamps and development programs
* New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan
* Generous and competitive benefits (parental leave, fertility & wellbeing support)


 To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!
   

  

 MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.
   

  

 MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer.

title: Content Manager to Digital Sales & Engagement - temporary position
description:
**Job ID: 25061** 
  
 





  
 





 At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. With us, you’ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger. 
 





  
 






**About this opportunity** 







  
 






 Welcome to Data, Digital Sales & Engagement in Personal Banking and a strong community of experts and people with passion for engaging with customers across digital platforms. Digital Sales & Engagement is responsible for engaging with prospects and customers across the full digital customer journey from external paid channels to our own channels (website and logged-in) as well as through personalized in-app messages, emails and lead generation to physical channels. 
 






  
 





 Are you a passionate and skilled digital Content Manager and writer looking for an exciting opportunity to drive digital sales at a company with a very ambitious growth strategy? We are growing our Swedish team and now looking for an experienced, creative and data-driven colleague to focus on one of our customer journeys.
 





  
 





 You will become a trusted member in a data-driven team of multi competences focused on performance and committed to maximizing returns on online investments and elevating customer experience.
 





  
 





 This is a temporary position of a year and you are based in Stockholm. We work from the office and have a hybrid set-up.
 





  
 






**What you’ll be doing:** 






* Together in your journey team with multiple competences, focus on and co-create better and new ways to reach the set KPIs with content – all in an agile set-up
* Sharing knowledge and best practice of content to colleagues and stakeholders to ensure accessibility, engagement and sales impact
* Daily omni-channel content management, including creating, editing, optimizing and publishing to ensure great customer experiences on our website and logged in channels
* Work closely with colleagues in and outside the team brainstorming ideas, creating concepts and adding business value to our customers and prospects
* Quality assure copy, tone of voice, images and flows within your journey



  
 






**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 






* Live and breathe digital - it’s a huge part of the way you live and work
* Are a natural born writer, in Swedish, with a great eye for copywriting and understand what it takes to grab a reader’s attention in the digital landscape.
* Have a customer centric approach and base decisions on data and SEO, amongst other relevant insights
* Are a well-organised, independent and curious self-starter with a proven ability in enabling and producing high-quality content that drives sales & engagement
* Love working with others to co-create business value through content
* Are a pragmatic problem solver focusing on solutions that take you forward
* Have good key stakeholder management skills



  
 






**Your experience and background has:** 
  
 





* Digital copywriting and content creation skills, meaning: you are a great writer, you understand how customers respond to copy, images and visual communication. You know how to make them convert based on their needs
* Vast knowledge of how to work with different customer segments and to identify customer journeys and personas to create consistent content across the funnel. You love to create communication that starts with the customer
* Well experienced with a growth mindset – you are used to working in an iterative way, and to drive a hypothesis based agenda to test and improve the conversion rates and the customer journeys for our channels. You are data-driven in your core – and you understand why you need to be
* Knowledge of how to adapt and create great content based on search engine optimisation (SEO) principles, both on your own as well as collaborating with specialists in order to increase organic traffic to our website
* Experience from working agile (SAFe/Scrum/Kanban)
* Daily experience from various Content Management Systems, ie Tridion and other relevant tools and platforms: Keyword Planners, Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target and Siteimprove
* Basic knowledge in Photoshop to manage editing images for page layout
* A good feeling for the overall visual content in order to create a consistent experience
* Relevant academic or equivalent higher education



  
 






 If this sounds like you, get in touch! 
 






  
 






**Next steps** 







  
 





 Submit your application no later than 31/07/2024 – in Swedish or English. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Haleh Ladi-Damström, Head of Content & Optimization, haleh.ladi-damstrom@nordea.com (+46702353341
 


 )
 


 . Interviews will be held continuously.
 





  
 





 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are. We apply a hybrid office/remote work set-up.
 





  
 





 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
